CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 10, 1955, pg. 4 reads: "Protest Rezoning - City Council heard arguments, pro and con, Tuesday, concerning the proposed ordinance to change from Class "B" to "A" property bounded by Chalfont Street, Delmont Avenue, Bolivar Way and Gearing Avenue, in the Eighteenth Ward (Beltzhoover), that wouldn't permit the establishment of a funeral home at 616 Delmont Avenue...right, Ralph B. Mellix of 713 Gearing Avenue, speaking in favor of the ordinance, while members of City Council listen attentively.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Ralph B. Mellix, speaking to City Council Members regarding rezoning in Beltzhoover, gathered in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers at the City County Building
